com.michaelRunzler.ARK.android.util.ButtonVariants

Class HybridTargetActivatorButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.michaelRunzler.ARK.android.util.ButtonVariants.HybridSettingsButton
      • com.michaelRunzler.ARK.android.util.ButtonVariants.HybridTargetActivatorButton

  • public class HybridTargetActivatorButton
extends HybridSettingsButton

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.michaelRunzler.ARK.android.util.ButtonVariants.HybridSettingsButton

        DEFAULT_DESC, DEFAULT_ICON, desc, icon, linkedButton, linkedText, linkedView, settingID

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HybridTargetActivatorButton(android.widget.RelativeLayout view, java.lang.String desc, android.graphics.drawable.Drawable icon, java.lang.String settingID, boolean initialState, TargetActivatorButtonEventHandler handler)
      Functions aa sub-variant of the basic HybridBooleanSelectButton, but when the user clicks the button, the state is not automatically toggled, and an externally-defined action may be taken as specified by a TargetActivatorButtonEventHandler object, essentially making the button's function customizable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HybridTargetActivatorButton

        public HybridTargetActivatorButton(@NonNull
                                   android.widget.RelativeLayout view,
                                   @Nullable
                                   java.lang.String desc,
                                   @Nullable
                                   android.graphics.drawable.Drawable icon,
                                   java.lang.String settingID,
                                   boolean initialState,
                                   TargetActivatorButtonEventHandler handler)
        Functions aa sub-variant of the basic HybridBooleanSelectButton, but when the user clicks the button, the state is not automatically toggled, and an externally-defined action may be taken as specified by a TargetActivatorButtonEventHandler object, essentially making the button's function customizable. All other functionality is exactly the same as the HybridBooleanSelectButton.
        Parameters:
        view - the Hybrid Button XML element to link this object to. Cannot be null. The Context being used by this element will be used to derive such things as colors, preset Strings, and element unit IDs. This context is not cached for future use.
        desc - The text to show on the button. Setting this to null will default it to 'Button'.
        icon - The Drawable reference to set this button's icon to. Setting this to null will default it to the Android 'New Folder' icon.
        initialState - the value that the button should store as its initial internal state. Useful if the program using the button needs to preset the value to a default, previously set value, or something similar. This value will also be used as the initial default state.
        settingID - the SettingsManager Setting ID to use for processing output. Setting this to null will cause interaction handling to update only the internal state variable, and not the settings index.
        handler - the TargetActivatorButtonEventHandler to handle interaction with the button. null values will simply cause any interaction to be ignored.

    • Method Detail

      • handleInteract

        public void handleInteract(SettingsManager manager)
        Handles an interact request for this button object. Automatically updates the button's appearance and stored state when finished. Will not take any action if the Handler class provided is null.
        Specified by:
        handleInteract in class HybridSettingsButton
        Parameters:
        manager - the SettingsManager object to deliver the updated state to. If null, this object will skip result delivery and simply update its internal state.
        See Also:
        HybridSettingsButton.handleInteract()

      • getState

        public boolean getState()
        Gets this button's internal stored state.
        Returns:
        the boolean that this object is storing as its state

      • setState

        public void setState(boolean state)
        Sets this button's stored state. This determines the button's displayed state, as well as how it handles return values from interact requests.
        Parameters:
        state - the boolean that this button should store as its internal state

      • getHandler

        public TargetActivatorButtonEventHandler getHandler()
        Gets the current handler for this button.
        Returns:
        the currently set TargetActivatorButtonEventHandler object

      • setHandler

        public void setHandler(TargetActivatorButtonEventHandler handler)
        Sets the handler object for this button.
        Parameters:
        handler - the TargetActivatorButtonEventHandler to handle interaction with the button. null values will simply cause any interaction to be ignored.

      • updateLinkedView

        Description copied from class: HybridSettingsButton

        Overrides:
        updateLinkedView in class HybridSettingsButton

      • setDefaultState

        public void setDefaultState(boolean defaultState)
        Sets the default state of this object to the specified boolean value. By default, false is used as the default state.
        Parameters:
        defaultState - the boolean to use as this object's default state

      • loadDefaultState

        public void loadDefaultState(SettingsManager manager)
        Description copied from class: HybridSettingsButton
        Resets this button to its default state. The default state may be specified manually with the setDefault method (implemented by subclasses). This only loads default settings for the stored data state of the object, and not its appearance.
        Specified by:
        loadDefaultState in class HybridSettingsButton
        Parameters:
        manager - the SettingsManager object to push the updated state to. If null, this object will skip pushing the new state and simply update its internal value.
        See Also:
        HybridSettingsButton.loadDefaultState()
